message:
Yes, this is a no-name site that no-one's ever heard of and which has zero credibility. Yes, this is probably doesn't even carry enough weight to be considered a rumour. BUT...

On the remote, distant, infinitesimal chance that this is true, we're potentially looking at one of the greatest video games ever made.

http://www.iwaggle3d.com/2011/05/rumor-platinum-games-in-charge-for-mgs.html

"A reliable source told iWaggle3D today that the Raiden-centered MGS spin-off Metal Gear Solid Rising has switched developer, escaping Kojima Production to infiltrate Platinum Games (Bayonetta, Vanquish). Viewtiful Joe and Bayonetta creator Hideki Kamiya is apparently directing the game. "

Kojima has been tweeting about having to let go of a project he's been working on for years.

You're right, though, probably all wild rumour.  Sill, imagine that.
I can't actually "imagine that" just now. Because I'm in public, and it'd get embarrassingly inappropriate.
Kojima is making some announcements next week (2 June) - one of them looks likely to be the PS3 remaster of Peace Walker, but I'm sure there will also be some news about MGS Rising and the 3DS MGS...

Still, there is just not enough MGS to keep me satisfied. Since PS1 (which I personally take as the first MGS) we're only about to see the 5th game? No, no, no... someone needs to get a Ubisoft developer into that team. We need a MGS every year. At least.
Oh, and I was talking console. Not handheld and not remakes (Twin Snakes, etc)

Yes, if you arbitrarily change your criteria so that you effectively disqualify half the franchise, we're only about to get to the fifth game :P

Personally, I can't believe there's never been a Resident Evil game. (oh, I'm only counting games specifically made for the current gen, and not handheld, and not multi-platform, and not with cooperative modes)
